Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • classes.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represent the player. It contains the main method and the intelligent of the program
    Author:
    Morettini

      • main

      • nextMove

        static int nextMove(Board board,
                    java.util.ArrayList<Piece> freePieces,
                    Piece toPosition,
                    java.lang.Boolean turn,
                    int depth,
                    int alpha,
                    int beta)
        This method calculates the best position for the player. It uses an algorithm similar to the Minimax. It is a recursive function which creates dynamically a tree which explores some possible combinations. It stops itself after some branches because otherwise the execution time would be too long. At the end of the execution of the method, in indexBestPosition will be contained the position that the algorithm has decided to be the best to put the piece in. Into indexBestPieceForEnemy there's going to be the index of the piece for enemy. Each index refers respectively to the board object and to the list of notUsedPieces. The program aims for maximum points, the adversary aims for the minimum points. Alpha contains the maximum points that program could achieve while beta contains the minimum points that the adversary could achieve
        Parameters:
        board - Current board where the game is played.
        freePieces - list of not used pieces
        toPosition - piece to place
        turn - it's a boolean variable, if it's true and it is Computer's turn. otherwise it's adversary's turn.
        depth - depth of this iteration
        alpha - highest result for the player in the father branch
        beta - lower result for the enemy in the father branch
        Returns:
        the best result possible for the Player
